p: Finally, specific comparisons allow for the investigation of regulatory differences between tumours classified according to various parameters: survival time [ 134], angiogenic features [ 71], type of treatment [ 135] and genomic stress [ 136]. A comprehensive study compared high and low genomic stress tumours in 15 cancer types, identifying 101 modules activated by genomic stress based on CNV, expression data, and PPI networks [ 136]. Within these, up-regulated hubs have been proposed as non-oncogene addiction genes for further functional studies. In the same vein, the differential co-expression module multivariate analysis method MultiDCox has been applied to breast cancer, revealing gene sets associated with mutant p53, ER status and grade [ 95].
